job description:
This role will support all projects within the Molecular Biology group. Responsible for the construction, screening and characterization of recombinant P. fluorescens strains.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Accountable for personal technical goals which align with project
  • Carrying out experiments, interpreting data, to meet project milestones.
  • Use known or develop specific techniques/technology to solve problems within Molecular
  • Perform efficient gene cloning including the design of constructs and primers, PCR amplification, and DNA sequencing and
  • Design and construct various microbial genes and strains, execute strain analysis procedures, and carry out and troubleshoot protocols for mutagenesis and
  • Perform protein analysis such as cell fractionation, SDS-PAGE gel and Western
  • Independently perform HTP strain expression and analysis using appropriate statistical tests and
  • Deliver presentations that distill complex ideas and proactively communicate results and progress to technical teams and
  • Troubleshoot and improve protocols for increased speed or precision, as required
  • Identify and introduce new technologies and ways to improve assay performance and laboratory
  • Seek to understand capabilities across disciplines and use innovative, collaborative approach for solving technical
  • Author technical documents, including SOPs, that describe the methods used and operation of laboratory instruments/equipment or
  • Capture IP through clear documentation of experiments and results
  • Expand breadth of skills through participation on projects which utilize diverse techniques or

JOB SKILLS, ABILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS
  • BS/MS in biology, molecular biology, microbiology, or biochemistry
  • BS/MS 2 years relevant experience
  • Proficient in molecular biology techniques such as nucleic acid isolation and digestion, DNA cloning, PCR/ QPCR, DNA sequencing, and RNAseq
  • Good documentation practices are essential
  • Knowledge of GLP compliance essential; knowledge of ISO9000, and cGMP regulatory guidelines desirable
  • Must be proficient in MS Word, Excel, and Powerpoint. JMP or other statistical package
  • Must be proficient in DNA sequence analysis software, e.g. sequencher, DNAstar, VectorNTI and possess basic bioinformatics skills e.g: working knowledge of BLAST, SignalP, CLUSTAL, etc.
  • Good problem-solving skills
  • Flexible hours essential, be available to troubleshoot equipment and process issues during off-hours.
